title: I'm 20 years old now. Is it too late to start learning modern dancing? - Quora
tags: Life Advice for People in Their 60's
Life Advice for People in Their 20s

response.answer_text: If you mean Modern Dance in the sense of Martha Graham, Paul Taylor, Mark Morris, it might not be, depending on other factors such as your level of fitness and any background in martial arts or gymnastics or the like. Modern dance is often taught in colleges and there isn' t as much urgency to get somewhere and audition the way there is with ballet or Broadway dance. But you may have some catching up to do.

NO!! Depending on you any age is a good age to learn dancing. Weather it’s modern dancing or not. My parents were in their 70’s and were dancing. my parent started me dancing when I was 8 or 9. I would practice at home dancing with my Mother, my sister, even with a pillow. I’m in my 80’s now. Don’t really care for the modern music or style of dancing. I liked the old fashion way wear you held onto each other and danced cheek to cheek and gave your partner a “smooch” on her ear or her neck——maybe even a “belly” rub or two!!
